title: Selsey Bill Walking Route

nearby.description: East Wittering To West Wittering Beach Walk
Walk From Selsey To West Wittering

images.title: Beach at Selsey Bill by Chris Gunns, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beach at Selsey Bill

images.title: Simon Carey / Footpath, East Beach
images.caption: Footpath, East Beach. Built along the top of the sea defences with the green to the left giving some idea of the height. The Manhood Peninsula on which Selsey is located suffers badly from sea erosion with an estimated half a mile being lost in the south since Saxon times.

images.title: Simon Carey / Slipway, East Beach
images.caption: Slipway, East Beach. At the northern end of the park that is located on the other side of the sea wall.

images.title: Simon Carey / Boats, East Beach, Selsey
images.caption: Boats, East Beach

images.title: Selsey Bill public house, Selsey by Stacey Harris, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Selsey Bill public house, Selsey

images.title: East Beach Pond, Selsey by David Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: East Beach Pond, Selsey. This little wildlife pond is located just north of Selsey Bill. There is an information board detailing the flora and fauna you can see at the site.

images.title: Selsey High Street by Malc McDonald, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Selsey High Street

images.title: Sea defences at Selsey Bill by Stefan Czapski, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sea defences at Selsey Bill

description: This walk visits the southernmost point of Sussex in the town of Selsey. You can park at the East Beach car park to start your walk. From there it's a nice 1 mile walk along the pretty beach to Selsey Bill. After your walk you can enjoy refreshments in one of the cafes. The area is also well known for its excellent fresh fish huts. The walk can be extended by visiting the nearby Pagham Harbour. It's located just to the north of Selsey and includes a fantastic nature reserve with thousands of wading birds. If you head north west from the headland you can visit East Wittering and West Wittering with views of Bracklesham Bay. Here you can enjoy a walk through the sand dunes at East Head and pick up the long distance New Lipchis Way to take you into Chichester. You can also enjoy more nice walking trails around Chichester Harbour and Thorney Island .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Lifeboat Inn is positioned in a lovely spot close to the sea front. They serve good quality food which you can enjoy outside with a lovely view. You can find them on Albion Road at postcode PO20 0DJ for your sat navs. The pub is dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Selsey To West Wittering Walk will take you west to West Wittering via the RSPB Medmerry Nature Reserve. The nearby reserve is a great place for cycling and walking with a wide variety of wildlife to see. For more walking ideas in the area see the Sussex Walks page.

display_address: Beach Road, East Beach, Selsey, Chichester, West Sussex, England, PO20 0SN, United Kingdom
